pull.title: doc: Fix OSS-Fuzz links
pull.body:
* Add missing link to the coverage report
* Replace unqualified link with qualified one

doc: Fix OSS-Fuzz links

events.body:
ACK fadd98d02f5ebb07a68006f6a0b33881fdf78505

Makes sense to point to the relevant vulnerabilities and not to the general list. The coverage report link is nice added context.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -234,11 +234,13 @@ $ honggfuzz/honggfuzz --exit_upon_crash --quiet --timeout 4 -n 1 -Q \
 # OSS-Fuzz
 
 Bitcoin Core participates in Google's [OSS-Fuzz](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/tree/master/projects/bitcoin-core)
-program, which includes a dashboard of [publicly disclosed vulnerabilities](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/list).
comments.body: Sorry for not catching this while reviewing pre-merge, but should this URL be https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/list?q=bitcoin-core&can=1 (open issues + closed issues) instead of https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/list?q=bitcoin-core (open issues)? :)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -234,11 +234,13 @@ $ honggfuzz/honggfuzz --exit_upon_crash --quiet --timeout 4 -n 1 -Q \
 # OSS-Fuzz
 
 Bitcoin Core participates in Google's [OSS-Fuzz](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz/tree/master/projects/bitcoin-core)
-program, which includes a dashboard of [publicly disclosed vulnerabilities](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/list).
comments.body: There is a drop-down where you can select all issues
